pests.name: Aphids
pests.description: Small sap-sucking insects that cluster on seedlings
mitigation: Introduce natural predators like ladybugs.
Prune infested growth
Plant garlic to deter Aphids. Plant Basil to repel Aphids.

pests.name: Tomato hornworm
pests.description: Green caterpillars that chew through tomato leaves and fruit.
mitigation: Handpick and remove
Plant basil and marigolds to repel Hornworms. Plant dill to attract their natural predators.
pests.notes: Grows into the hummingbird moth, a nocturnal pollinator

pests.name: Spider mites
pests.description: Tiny red or yellow mites that feed on plants, causing damage to leaves.
mitigation: Rinse plants with strong water spray
Increase humidity around plants.
Plant Chives and Garlic to repel, plant dill to attract natural predators.
pests.notes: Thrives in dry weather; common on tomatoes, beans, and ornamentals.

pests.name: Cabbage worms
pests.description: Green caterpillars that chew holes in brassica vegetables.
mitigation: Handpick caterpillars
Plant sage and marigolds to repel, Plant rosemary to deter adult moths.
pests.notes: Attracted to members of the cabbage family; grows into white moths and/or butterflies, depending on species

pests.name: Cutworms
pests.description: Larvae that hide in soil and cut young seedlings
mitigation: Remove plant debris
Till the soil before planting to expose larvae
Plant dill, parsley, and cilantro to deter and attract natural predators.
pests.notes: Active at night; affects tomatoes, peppers, and other pottable plants.

pests.name: Squash bugs
pests.description: Flat, brown insects that feed on squash and pumpkins.
mitigation: Hand remove bugs and eggs
Clean up plant debris after harvest.
Plant radish and mint to deter, plant marigolds to protect the plant from pests.
pests.notes: A major pest of summer and winter squash; can transmit plant disease.

pests.name: Flea beetles
pests.description: Small jumping beetles that chew tiny holes in leaves of many plants.
mitigation: Use Mulch to restrict the beetles' movement.
Plant catnip and marigolds to repel, plant mint to drive them away.
pests.notes: Common on eggplant, tomatoes, and leafy greens in Oklahoma gardens.

pests.name: Grasshoppers
pests.description: Multi-colored large jumping/flying insects that chew leaves.
mitigation: Use netting
Plant cilantro, horseradish, marigolds, and lavender to repel pests.
Encourage birds and beneficial insects
pests.notes: Populations increase during dry summers; very common across Oklahoma.
